definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to grow/to nourish/to increase/to cause/juice/taste/(dialect) to spout/to spurt

sentences.english: However, it can also become a nuisance if we use it improperly .
sentences.chinese: 然而，它也可以成为滋扰，如果我们使用不当。

sentences.english: Any interference with homeostasis is likely to be damaging to the organism.
sentences.chinese: 对体内均衡的任何滋扰都有可能损害人的有机体。

sentences.english: The horse in the meadow is pestered by flies.
sentences.chinese: 牧场上的马不断受马蝇滋扰。

sentences.english: The money paid in such a settlement is often termed nuisance money.
sentences.chinese: 在此种调解中支付的费用经常被称为摆脱诉讼滋扰费。

sentences.english: The picnickers were annoyed by the bees.
sentences.chinese: 那些野餐的人受到了蜜蜂的滋扰。

sentences.english: The villagers banded themselves together to protect their homes from the scoundrels.
sentences.chinese: 村民们联合起来保卫他们的家庭以防流氓的滋扰。

definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to disturb/to cause a commotion/to harass
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
unable to put up with (sth) any longer
to start a rebellion/to rise in revolt
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
